channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-5741] Fix binary packaging build eg include hcatalog, resolve pom issues
item.description:
There are a couple issues with our current binary tarball:

  • HCatalog is not included
  • We include many jars which we don't need and which break things
item.summary: Fix binary packaging build eg include hcatalog, resolve pom issues

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Thejas M Nair, Ashutosh Chauhan over here I asked:

"The ant binary tarball had an hcatalog directory and all hcatalog stuff was located there. I believe part of the reason was that with the ant build the hive and hcatalog builds were somewhat separate. The two builds are very much integrated at this point, therefore I'd like to eliminate this hcatalog directory and include the stuff that was under bin/ under the hive bin/ etc.

Do you see an issue with this or are you opposed to this?"

If I don't hear back I'll go ahead with eliminating the hcatalog directory.

I think it is better to keep at least the lib dir separate. As the hcatalog jars are not needed by hive, we would be unnecessarily adding additional jars to hive classpath if we put them in the lib dir.
Having hcat bin/ contents in same dir as hive bin dir should be alright.

better to keep at least the lib dir separate

good call
On this item I think we should just keep the project structure as-is.

OK the attached patches adds hcatalog to the binary tarball with mostly the same structure as the 0.12 release. The delta is just that some jars have moved slightly and there is significantly less jars in the webcat server lib directory. Those two items will be addressed in followups.

Additionally because the binary tarball lib directory was so dirty I have used "dependency management" in the root pom to enforce our versions of jars.

Overall: -1 at least one tests failed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12613670/HIVE-5741.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12614075
+1 pending on followup item per review board discussion.

Hi,

I don't see that issue as being a blocker or urgent since all children use maven properties get their versions and those properties are specified in one place. Since this is blocking the hadoop 2 test environment can we address that in a follow-on jira?

Brock
Follow-on jira created @ HIVE-5833
Thanks for the followup JIRA, which was what I meant.
Thank you for the review! I have committed this to trunk.
